name: Classic Chicken Stir-Fry
description: A quick, healthy, and flavorful stir-fry packed with protein and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Mince the garlic and stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Slice the chicken breast and cook until golden and cooked through.
Slice the bell pepper. Add broccoli florets and bell pepper to the wok, stirring frequently for 4-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute. Serve immediately.

name: Hearty Lentil Soup
description: A comforting and nutritious vegan soup that's perfect for a cold day.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Chop the onion, dice the carrots and celery. Add to the pot and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Mince the garlic, stir it in with the thyme, and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Rinse the lentils, then add them to the pot with the vegetable broth and diced tomatoes (undrained).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

name: Simple Salmon & Asparagus
description: An elegant and easy one-pan meal, perfect for a quick weeknight dinner.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Trim the asparagus. On a baking sheet, toss asparagus with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place salmon fillets on the same baking sheet, skin-side down.
Cut the lemon in half. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the salmon and asparagus. Season the salmon with salt and pepper.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with the remaining lemon wedges.

name: Quick Avocado Toast with Egg
description: A classic, balanced breakfast or snack that's ready in minutes.
instructions: While the bread is toasting, cook the egg to your liking (fried, poached, or scrambled).
In a small bowl, mash the avocado with a fork. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly on the toasted bread.
Top with the cooked egg.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes, if using.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: A simple, protein-packed breakfast or dessert that requires no cooking.
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer half of the Greek yogurt.
Top with half of the mixed berries and half of the granola.
Repeat the layers: remaining yogurt, remaining berries, and remaining granola.
Drizzle with honey or maple syrup, if desired.
